item.title: Broken metal pole from dog waste bin, 26th July
item.description:
Previously I reported a fallen dog waste bin. It was reported as fixed even though it was not. Later the fallen dog waste bin. Not only it hasn't been fixed, but now there is a very dangerous pole remain with sharp metal edges that are safety hazard. This should be fixed asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Huguenot Square, Peckham, London

item.title: 4 out of the 6 car chargers are out of service, 26th July
item.description:
Four of the six car chargers are out of service. I contacted the firm (ConnectedKerb) and they responded that they "have not been switched on by the local authority." Please switch them on?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clissold Crescent, Hackney, London

item.title: Large sign on side of building occupation rd se17, 26th July
item.description:
I asked the contractors who stated they were employed by Notting Hill Genesis to put this sign up, not very happy this sign is awful and has what I think conflicting info. Sign says you have arrived at the arches and has arrows pointing. This sign is at the end of occupation rd so you havenâ€™t arrived at the arches and the arrows are pointing to the building itâ€™s attached to not to the arches on Angel lane itâ€™s silly I also have doubts about the material used for the sign being on a building and fire safety as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Place, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous piles of rubbish at this location (ðŸ˜­ rriby restaurants and shops), 26th July
item.description:
I have reported littering at this site numerous times. I have asked for signs to be placed on the wall /tree where rubbish is dumped on a daily basis. It smells, spreads all across our street and is an unpleasant site. We need a permanent solution.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain at this location is blocked causing flooding across the road., 26th July
item.description:
The drain at this junction is blocked and because of this, when it rains, it floods halfway across the road and also onto the pavement which means pedestrians cannot use the crossing because of the deep water and the risk of getting soaked by passing cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Manorway, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signage Angel lane, 26th July
item.description:
Itâ€™s signage over kill, now a main sign has been put on the brick wall which Iâ€™m assuming has permission from rail network. The other 2 advertised frames leaning against the wall for the bakery is over kill and needs to be removed from the walkway. It looks unprofessional, dogs are urinating up against it there is enough there is enough advertising at the end of Angel lane you have the large frame on brick wall and above store there is a block sign and opposite there is a large stand alone sign advertising the names of all the sores on Angel lane. Please also check the large signs on brick wall on either side of Angel lane and all the block signs near the cctv going along as Iâ€™m sure this brick wall belongs to network rail and would require permission to put these up as well as fire safety with the materials that have been use.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Angel Lane, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
